Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Do not flush the position to master.info file if we have a transaction open 
 
 sql/slave.h@1.20 2002-06-22 20:00:17+03:00 heikki@mysql.fi 
 history annotate diffs 
 
 Do not flush the position to master.info file if we have a transaction open

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Add BEGIN andd COMMIT around transactions in the binlog 
 
 sql/log.cc@1.63 2002-06-22 20:05:16+03:00 heikki@mysql.fi 
 history annotate diffs 
 
 Add BEGIN andd COMMIT around transactions in the binlog

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Merge 3.23.52

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Add option innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=2 which means we always write the log to file at commit, but only do fsync about once per second

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Add syntax SET NO_FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=1 and SET RELAXED_UNIQUE_CHECKS=1

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Use current_thd to check if a transaction is done by a slave thread

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Merge 3.23.52

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Initing a mutex with MY_MUTEX_INIT_FAST may relieve thread thrashing on Linux

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Slave thread is always in an auto-commit state: remove unnecessary tests when we flush master info

Document.author: Sinisa@nasamreza.org
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 A fix for small error in displaying db names in SHOW GRANTS

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Crash the server if file flush does not succeed: the database can get corrupt, better to crash it than let it run

Document.author: Sinisa@nasamreza.org
Document.document:
all diffs diff -Nur style patch Bookmarkable link 
 
 Trying to make Arjen happy ...

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Fix a bug: if buffer pool size > 2 GB on a 32-bit computer, we got an assertion failure because >> acted as a division operator (not as a register shift) for a wrapped-over integer value

Document.author: Sinisa@nasamreza.org
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Small typo as reported by one registered customer

Document.author: monty@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Changelog

Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Auto merged 
 
 configure.in@1.182 2002-06-29 01:07:06+03:00 monty@mysql.fi

Document.author: monty@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Changelog and fix of typo

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Fix a bug: if the primary key was updated (or delete + insert) so that only the case of characters changed, we were left with a dangling adaptive hash index pointer, often causing an assertion failure in page0page.ic line 515

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Remove freeing of all memory at shutdown: since we do not exit the i/o-handlers and other threads, we could potentially get a seg fault at shutdown

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Clarify the setting of innodb_data_file_path in my.cnf: it is in the [mysqld] section

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Remove a debug printf which unintentionally was committed to the source tree

Document.author: serg@mysql.com
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 do not crash on myrg_rprev/myrg_rnext if no current table 
 (as when previous myrg_rkey failed, e.g. found nothing)

Document.document:

history annotate diffs 
 
 Fix for access problem (merge from 4.0)

Document.author: lenz@mysql.com
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Updated Packager Tag

Document.author: lenz@mysql.com
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Fixed typo

Document.author: lenz@mysql.com
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Added a SMP-related patch for PPC64 (provided by SuSE)

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Revert Monty's change to the positioning of ha_drop_database(): otherwise a running query on a table to be dropped in DROP DATABASE always causes the server to hang

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 On Monty's suggestion move ha_drop_database back inside LOCK_mysql_create_db, but we release LOCK_open during it to let possible running queries complete. I tested this and it seemed to work also in complex concurrent DELETE, SELECT, DROP DATABASE, and CREATE DATABASE situations

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Increase max number of waiting threads to 10000 and put diagnostic prints if this value is exceeded

Document.author: bar@izhnet.ru
Document.document: history annotate diffs \n \n

 history annotate diffs

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 Suppress prints by slave.cc when there is a normal reconnect after the master has been quiet for the time of the net read timeout; this removes the Error 1159 messages many users have complained about in the replication of 3.23.51

Document.author: heikki@mysql.fi
Document.document:
history annotate diffs 
 
 On Monty's suggestion move ha_drop_database back inside LOCK_mysql_create_db, but we release LOCK_open during it to let possible running queries complete. I tested this and it seemed to work also in complex concurrent DELETE, SELECT, DROP DATABASE, and CREATE DATABASE situations
